text.0: with thee o agni was this singer of the laud he hath no other kinship o thou son of strength.
text.1: thou givest blessed shelter with a triple guard keep the destructive lightning far away from us.
text.2: thy birth who seekest food is in the falling flood agni as comrade thou winnest all living things.
text.3: our coursers and our songs shall be victorious they of themselves advance like one who guards the herd.
text.4: and thou o agni thou of godlike nature sparest the stones while caring up the brushwood.
text.5: then are thy tracks like deserts in the cornlands let us not stir to wrath thy mighty arrow.
text.6: oer hills through vales devouring as thou goest thou partest like an army fain for booty.
text.7: as when a barber shaves a beard thou shavest earth when the wind blows on thy flame and fans it.
text.8: apparent are his lines as he approaches the course is single but the cars are many.
text.9: when agni thou making thine arms resplendent advancest oer the land spread out beneath thee.
text.10: now let thy strength thy burning flames fly upward thine energies o agni as thou toilest.
text.11: gape widely bend thee waxing in thy vigour let all the vasus sit this day beside thee.
text.12: this is the waters reservoir the great abode of gathered streams.
text.13: take thou another path than this and as thou listest walk thereon.
text.14: on thy way hitherward and hence let flowery durva grass spring up.
text.15: let there be lakes with lotus blooms these are the mansions of the flood.
